sen.j: 桜川 大龍（さくらがわ だいりゅう、本名：西沢寅吉、文化 (元号)6年（1809年） - 明治23年（1890年3月29日）は江州音頭の宗家。
sen.e: Dairyu SAKURAGAWA (his real name: Torakichi NISHIZAWA, 1809 - March 29, 1890) is Soke (the owner of the highest-graded patches of land under the stratified land ruling structure of Shoen, the same as Honke in this manner) of Goshu ondo.

sen.j: 桜川歌寅と称して歌念仏・貝祭文・念仏踊りを祭文語りに取り入れた独自の節回しの音頭を考案し、祭文音頭と言われた。
sen.e: He was referred to himself as 桜川歌寅, and created Ondo (fork tune) with melodies in his own style, including uta (song) nenbutsu (Buddhist prayer), kai (shell) saimon (address to the gods), nenbutsu-odori dance in saimon (address to the gods) naration, which was called Saimon Ondo (folk tune)
